alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Clatsop, northern Columbia, southeastern Pacific, southeastern Wahkiakum and northwestern Cowlitz Counties through 830 AM PDT... At 800 AM PDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Mist, or 9 miles south of Cathlamet, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kelso, Castle Rock, Cathlamet, Longview, Rainier, Clatskanie, West Longview, Longview Heights, West Side Highway, Stella, Silver Lake, Toutle, East Cathlamet, Prescott, Westport, Quincy, Oak Point, Ostrander, Carrolls and Lexington. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 5 between mile markers 31 and 55. State Route 4 between mile markers 34 and 62. State Route 504 between mile markers 1 and 17. In Oregon this includes U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 42 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Coast; Willapa Hills
